shackle.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one of a pair of metal rings joined by a chain that are used for fastening together a prisoner’s hands or feet, so that they cannot move easily or escape
shackle.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to put many limits on what someone can do – used to show disapproval
shackle.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Industrial progress is being shackled by a mass of regulations.
shackle.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: He was blindfolded and shackled to a radiator.
